priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Nervous System Physiology Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C116103

self.title: CDISC SDTM Nervous System Physiology Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test names that describe nervous system physiology findings.
name: Nervous System Findings Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Nervous System Physiology Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of change in volume of an organ or anatomical feature as determined by a shift in tissue boundary over time.
An evaluation of the perfusion of blood through the brain.
A measurement of the free choline plus glycerophosphorylcholine (GCP) plus phosphorylcholine (PCh) in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Free Choline and Glycerophosphorylcholine and Phosphorylcholine Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the creatine plus phosphocreatine in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the glutamate and glutamine in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the glycerophosphorylcholine (GPC) plus phosphorylcholine (PC) in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the myo-inositol in a biological specimen.
A measurement of the N-acetyl aspartate in a biological specimen.
The length of time of N1 sleep.
A relative measurement (percentage) of the N1 sleep time to total sleep time.
terms.preferredTerm: N1 Sleep to Total Sleep Time Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An assessment of the latency of the N145 or N2 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform.
The length of time of N2 sleep.
A relative measurement (percentage) of the N2 sleep time to total sleep time.
terms.preferredTerm: N2 Sleep to Total Sleep Time Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: The length of time of N3 sleep.
A relative measurement (percentage) of the N3 sleep time to total sleep time.
terms.preferredTerm: N3 Sleep to Total Sleep Time Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: An assessment of the latency of the N75 or N1 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform.
A measurement of the N-acetylaspartate plus N-acetyl-aspartylglutamate in a biological specimen.
The magnitude, or height, of the P100 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform. This assessment calculates the height from the N75 negative peak to the P100 positive peak.
terms.preferredTerm: N75 to P100 Peak to Peak Amplitude

terms.definition: An assessment of the latency of the P100 or P1 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform.
The maximum height change between the wave and the equilibrium point of a stimulus-response waveform.
A measurement of the time interval between a stimulus and the maximal response.
The total amount of time an individual spends in rapid eye movement (REM) sleep.
terms.preferredTerm: Rapid Eye Movement Sleep Phase Duration

terms.definition: The time between the onset of sleep and the onset of the first rapid eye movement (REM) cycle.
terms.preferredTerm: Rapid Eye Movement Sleep Phase Latency

terms.definition: A relative measurement (percentage) of the rapid eye movement (REM) sleep time to total sleep time.
terms.preferredTerm: REM to Total Sleep Time Ratio Measurement

terms.definition: The degree to which the skin can conduct electricity.
A relative measurement (percentage) of the total sleep time (N1 sleep + N2 sleep + N3 sleep + REM sleep) to the total time spent in bed.
The duration of time between when the lights are turned off and when the individual falls asleep.
The ratio between the tissue radioactivity concentration at a point in time C(T) and the injected dose of radioactivity per kilogram of the patient's body weight.
The ratio between the uptake or binding of a radiopharmaceutical agent in an anatomical region of interest and a context-defined reference anatomical region.
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
The total amount of sleep time from sleep onset to sleep offset, determined by summing the N1 sleep, N2 sleep, N3 sleep, and REM sleep durations.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container. (NCI)
A measurement of the sum of durations of wakefulness episodes throughout the night, not including the wakefulness before sleep onset.
